main event: A fireball was sighted across several states and Canada on December 9, 1965, with various reports and investigations following the incident.
interesting points: The object was observed by airline pilots and numerous civilians across Indiana, Ohio, Pennsylvania, and Michigan., Despite extensive searches, no physical fragments of the object were recovered., The object was believed to have been a meteor, though its slow speed raised questions about this conclusion., A photographer from Michigan captured a picture of the fireball, though only negatives were available at the time of inquiry., The report indicated that the fireball was visible for 3-4 seconds and created an audible explosion that was thought to be a sonic boom.
witness description: Various witnesses including airline pilots and civilians in multiple states
